title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: So a customer of mine bought a sight unseen 820-00840 machine that is not turning on. On my USB-C am meter it is showing 19.8V @ .01mA. I am getting P3V3_G3H but not PPBUS. PPBUS_G3H is reading 1.9 Ohms to GND. I take it that is not good. Also, the only signs of liquid is by the battery.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
So after measuring all of the coils to compare with F7000 Pin 2, which is 1.9 Ohms, The following coils have the same reading:
L7410
L7420
L7430
All three measure 1.9 ohms to GND. Could all three of the HSM be shorted? or am I barking up the wrong tree? I do not have a known good board for comparison at the moment.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
Is sufficient that one chip (U7410/20/30) is shorted on high-side.
You must remove them one by one...

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: Are you saying that it could only be one that is short, but causing all three to show short?  Ill do a game  of eenie meenie miney mo

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: The three coils are tied together, so YES...

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: ok, so when i removed the first HSM, ppbus is not shorted anymore to GND, reading 1.5M ohm to gnd. Is it safe to plug board in with these removed to check ppbus voltage? the other thing Is I only have a 820-00875 as a possible donor. Should I try to get these HSM new or is that impossible? My client will wait if he has to.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
Get the chip from donor board.
All the boards 00840/50/75 have the same one.

But be aware, CPU could be already dead; overvoltage on VCCGT rail occured...

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: Took one from donor 875, computer now showing ? Folder and .625V CPU Vcore. The problem now is the fan is slowly ramping up to high speed, and when I plug in SSD, the progress bar starts moving fast, then stalls at about 90%.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
Probably temperature sensor error.
Try USB OSX and run HWMonitor, if you can get logged in.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: Yeah I cannot seem to get it to run even from a USB stick. when I try to select the drive to boot from I click on my USB vs internal SSD and I get a circle with a slash through it. I tried to run internet recovery and when I try to go to the name of my Wifi, the computer slows way down. one of the times I booted it I got some kind of kernal error but it diisappeared before I could see what it said. What I am wondering is even though I replaced U7430, the CPU might have gotten a small enough zap to render it useless but it still tries to work. I'm just not sure. I am going to keep attempting to either get it to boot from an external OS or get a different SSD.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
Remove internal SSD when you try to boot through USB.
Be sure your test OSX is supported by the machine.

Try to start in safe mode, or even SMC bypass; if cannot login other way.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: Sounds good, I will give it a try this evening.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: So it still will not boot from USB but I got it to boot into safe mode. Is HW monitor something on in the OS? or do I have to get it?

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
First of all, try to recover any data, if possible.
Next, do a fresh OS install.

"Is HW monitor something on in the OS? or do I have to get it?"
Find it with Google search.
You will need to diagnose many machines.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
Got HW monitor. The following are reading 128 degrees C:
airport proximity 
mainboard proximity 
heatpipe incoming air
heatpipe outgoing air

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
Try known good trackpad flex/board.
Palmrest temp sensor can block the bus and could be the reason of several temp errors.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: I thought it my be that so I ordered yesterday.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: So I replaced the TPAD and cable, now the the two heat pipe sensors are reading normal, but the Airport Proximity and the Mainboard proximity still reading 128 degrees C. The board is drawing 2.5A but the fans is spinning normally. The CPU is getting really hot. The fan does not turn on until the CPU is hot to the touch. Is this normal? It still will not boot to internal SSD unless in safe mode.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
Recover data if possible and do a fresh OSX install.
If fan runs normal, temps should be OK.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: ok will try that

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message: So I couldn't get a fresh install of OS to work, my customer bought another SSD for it so I put it in. Got it to load the OS once. Tried to play a YouTube video and there were allot of glitches and the computer was running very slow. Do you think the GPU/CPU is damaged? I am not sure what to do with this thing.

title: 820-00840 Not turning on
message:
There is no dedicated GPU; only iGPU abailable.
First try external monitor.
Let us know if video issue persists on both outputs.
